intro: Ailanthus rhodoptera, commonly known as the Chinese sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern Asia. It features compound leaves with 10 to 30 pairs of oval, serrated leaflets that turn vibrant red in the fall. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in panicles, which are followed by red, fuzzy berries that attract birds. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is adaptable to different light conditions. Botanically, it is characterized by its distinctive foliage and ecological role in supporting wildlife.
